description: Extension to balcony of existing  boathouse
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

A sample of the facing materials to be utilised in the development hereby permitted shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works on site are commenced. The development shall then be built in accordance with these approved samples.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012. These details are required prior to commencement of development because the details would affect subsequent design of other elements of the scheme and must be agreed at the outset.

Detailed drawings at the scale of (1:10) of the following shall be submitted to and be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the relevant part of work is begun. The  detail  thereby  approved  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  that approval in accordance with Policies DM10.- Window reveals, door reveals, overhangs, rainwater goods.Reason:  In the interests of visual amenity and the character of the area. These details are required prior to commencement of development to ensure the development would have a satisfactory appearance on completion.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details have been assessed by relevant consultants and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details, in relation to Condition 32 (Air Quality Generator Exhaust) of planning permission 21/04022/FUL, which states:Condition 32 - Prior to commencement of above ground works at the site the applicant must show that the placement of the 'life safety' generator exhaust point does not cause breaches of short term national air quality standards at any nearby residential properties during its regular testing. If dispersion modelling indicates that the current placement of the exhaustpoint could result in exceedances of the national air quality standards, the applicant must propose a new exhaust point to ensure the health and safety of residents nearby.Reason: To safeguard the health of neighbouring properties and future residents in the interests of air quality as set out in Policy SI 1 (Improving air quality) of the London Plan.

I acknowledge receipt of your payment for £34. The original application was a Full permission and therefore the fee required for this Discharge of Conditions application is £145. Please forward the outstanding balance of £111 as soon as possible.Note: Payment can be made online via the Kingston council website, via our Contact Centre on 020 8547 5002, or by cheque made payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames
